main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted near Adamant, Vermont on March 26, 1950. The object was described as 'silver colored' and was seen for approximately 5-7 minutes.
interesting points: The report contains information on seven alleged sightings of unidentified flying objects forwarded by various USAF Flight Service Center units.
There were a total of seven alleged sightings of unidentified flying objects in the US during March 1950.
The object sighted near Adamant, Vermont was reportedly silver colored and observed for 5-7 minutes, but no photographs or sketches were available.
The document is a scanned report from the US Air Force's Project Blue Book, a program that investigated unidentified flying object reports from 1947 to 1969.
The conclusion of the report stated that the sighting near Adamant, Vermont was classified as 'Possible A/C' (aircraft).
